com.i2group.apollo.model.data.transport

Class PropertyGroup

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.i2group.apollo.model.data.transport.PropertyGroup
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IIdentifiable

    public final class PropertyGroup
extends Object
implements IIdentifiable
    A group of related Propertys.

    Property groups provide a mechanism for representing non-atomic data through multiple related properties. For example, a property group could represent a body marking, with separate properties for the type, appearance, and location of the marking:

    Property Group Contents
    Body Marking Property Value
    Type Tattoo
    Appearance Rose
    Location Left arm

    Throughout its lifetime, a property group is subject to validation rules:

    • The identifier of the property group must be unique in the context of the Item that owns its enclosing Card.
    • The identifier of the property group's PropertyGroupType must correspond to a PropertyGroupType in the ItemType of the Item that owns the property group's enclosing Card.
    • If the identifier of the property group's PropertyGroupType corresponds to a mandatory PropertyGroupType, then the property group must contain at least one Property whose value is not null or an empty String.
    • See Property for more validation rules.
    Since:
    1.0

    • Constructor Detail

      • PropertyGroup

        public PropertyGroup(String id,
             String typeId,
             Collection<Property> properties)
        Constructs a new PropertyGroup by initializing all mandatory fields.
        Parameters:
        id - A String containing the identifier of the new PropertyGroup.
        typeId - A String containing the identifier of the new PropertyGroup's PropertyGroupType.
        properties - The Propertys that the new PropertyGroup contains.

    • Method Detail

      • getProperties

        public Collection<Property> getProperties()
        Gets the Propertys that this PropertyGroup contains.

        The returned Propertys includes all those that have values set, including those whose values have been set to null, but excluding those that have not been set at all.

        Note: It is legal for multiple Propertys to have the same PropertyType. This indicates that multiple values have been set for that particular type.

        Returns:
        See above.

      • getId

        public String getId()
        Gets a String containing the identifier of this PropertyGroup.
        Returns:
        See above.

      • getPropertyGroupTypeId

        public String getPropertyGroupTypeId()
        Gets a String containing the identifier of this PropertyGroup's PropertyGroupType.
        Returns:
        See above.
